meanings.definition: An exact copy or duplicate of something
meanings.sent1: In the movie, the replicants were created to look just like humans.
meanings.sent2: The replicants of famous paintings were so well-made that they fooled many art experts.
meanings.sent3: The replicants of the missing keys were scattered all over the house, confusing everyone.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was a replicant of joy, masking the sadness in her eyes.
meanings.sent5: The replicants of the ancient artifacts were so detailed, they seemed almost real.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that closely resembles or imitates another
meanings.sent1: The young singer was a replicant of the famous pop star, copying her style and songs.
meanings.sent2: The replicants of the superhero characters at the party delighted the children.
meanings.sent3: The replicants of the missing cat were actually just cleverly placed stuffed animals.
meanings.sent4: His smile was a replicant of his father's, showing the same warmth and kindness.
meanings.sent5: The replicants of the rare flowers in the garden were so lifelike, visitors often tried to touch them.
